thread.title: 2017 Oscars had the second-lowest ratings in Academy's history
thread.title_full: 2017 Oscars had the second-lowest ratings in Academy's history

author: PETER SBLENDORIO
title: 2017 Oscars had the second-lowest ratings in Academy's history
text:
This yearâ€™s Academy Awards suffered yet another ratings dip. (LUCY NICHOLSON/REUTERS) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS   4:42 PM 
A wild screw up at the end of the Academy Awards wasn't the headache the Oscars are dealing with. 
Sunday night's ceremony garnered just 32.9 million viewers, according to Nielsen, making it the second-least watched Oscars in the show's lengthy history. 
It barely avoided the dubious record of least-viewed Oscars, a feat belonging to the 2008 show, which drew a mere 32 million watchers. 
The show's viewership has been on decline in recent years, with the last impressive showing coming in 2014 when it drew 43.7 million viewers.
